answers.answer: HI,  Voiding frequently can be due to many problems.  First, you need to have your urine checked.  An infection can cause frequency, so a culture should be sent.  Blood in the urine can be due to a stone, tumor or injury, so a urinalysis should be sent.  Heavy glucose in the urine may be a sign of diabetes. If the urinalysis and culture are negative, your doctor need to check that you are emptying your bladder, and not in retention.  If you are emptying your bladder and your pelvic exam is normal, you may have overactive bladder.  Aalternatively you could have interstitial cystitis but usually you have pain, pressure or discomfort in the bladder along with your frequency.  You clearly need to see your doctor and get a basic evaluation for frequency, and possibly a referral to a Urologist or Gynecologist for further testing.  Good Luck---------------- David

question: I am 36 yr old female who has had recent constant urination right out of the CLEAR BLUE, what happened over night. Why am i starting urine so much? Help!!!
title: constant urinating
